questions.question_text:
The sales manager at Universal containers wants to ensure that bundles:

• Cannot be reconfigured when a Renewal Quote is created.
• Allow sales reps to configure bundles only on new or amendment quotes.

What should the CPQ specialist co to meet these requirements?

choices.B: Create a Custom Action Condition on the Reconfigure Line custom action where SBQQ__Type__c is equal to "Renewal".
choices.D: Ensure SBQQ__ReconfigurationDisabled__c is set to "Disabled" on the Bundle product.
choices.C: Create a Custom Action Condition on the Reconfigure Line custom action where SBQQ__Type__c is not equal to "Renewal".
choices.A: Ensure SBQQ__ReconfigurationDisabled__c is set to TRUE on the Bundle product.

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: C
Answer is C from https://milomassimo.com/Salesforce-CPQ-Control-Ability-to-Reconfigure-Bundles.html

Answer B. Salesforce CPQ includes a "Configuration Editable" field on the Product object, which controls when a bundle can be reconfigured.
Use the following formula logic to ensure bundles can only be configured on New or Amendment Quotes, but not on Renewal Quotes:
graphql
Copy code
IF(ISPICKVAL(SBQQ__Quote__r.SBQQ__Type__c, "Renewal"), FALSE, TRUE)
This formula evaluates the Quote Type field on the quote (SBQQ__Type__c):
If the Quote Type is "Renewal," it will set Configuration Editable to FALSE, which prevents reconfiguration of the bundle.
For all other Quote types (e.g., "New," "Amendment"), it will set Configuration Editable to TRUE, allowing sales reps to configure the bundle.

Selected Answer: B
To meet the requirements, the CPQ specialist should use option B, which is to create a Custom Action Condition on the Reconfigure Line custom action where SBQQ__Type__c is equal to "Renewal". This will disable the reconfiguration of bundles when a renewal quote is created.

comments.content:
Not A
Note that just as the Disable Reconfiguration field overrides the Configuration Event field set to Edit or Always, it also overrides whatever conditions we have specified for the Custom Action because it takes precedence. This means that if a product has this field set to True, the Reconfigure Line icon won't appear for it even though it's supposed to be rendered on new quotes and amendment quotes.

questions.question_text:
Universal Containers needs sales reps to look up Campaign records to associate with specific Quote Lines in the Quote Line Editor. The admin created a lookup field on the Quote Line object that relates to the Campaign object, then added the lookup field into the Line Editor Field Set on the Quote Line object.

What does the admin need to do so the sales reps can search Campaign records in the Quote Line Editor without seeing a warning message?

discussion.content:
B

this is the warning I see when clicking the Campaign lookup in my quote line editor:
Create a Field Set with the label of CPQ_Lookup in Campaign object setup to determine which fields are displayed in this CPQ list view popup.

choices.B: Create and populate a Field Set on the Campaign object named CPQ_Lookup.
choices.A: Add the name of the lookup field into the Line Editor Field Set on the Quote object.
choices.D: Create a twin field on the Campaign object using the same API name as the lookup field.
choices.C: Add the lookup field to the Quote Line page layout.

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: AD
I think it's A&D.
You can change a value in the Calculating Fields field set to refresh pricing. Additionally, there is a Calculate button available on Quote that can be added in to calculate the Quote Lines from the Quote screen. However, not fully sure, as the users would need to know what fields in the Calculating Fields field set can be used to recalculate.

choices.B: Create a new Lightning button to trigger recalculation.
choices.C: Create a Flow to trigger recalculation upon record save.
choices.A: Add the Calculate button to the quote layout.
choices.D: Change the value of a field in the Calculating Fields Field Set.

The Universal Containers sales operations team wants to ensure that without reopening the Quote Line Editor, quotes have the most current pricing logic prior to submitting them for approval.

Which two actions could the admin take to meet the business requirement? (Choose two.)

choices.B: The Line Subtotals Total field package setting
choices.C: The Segmented Summary Fields field set

discussion.content: D - Quote Line > Field Sets > Summary Fields: "Fields to be summarized in Line Editor. Note that field must also be in field set displayed on the page." I tested this with Quantity - it displays directly under the respective column

questions.question_text:
Universal Containers (UC) wants to display the sum of a custom field within the standard table of the Line Editor. UC wants to keep the original subtotal and total fields.

Where should the admin place the custom field to display this total?

discussion.content:
A. Rental Rates, Price Rules, Price Conditions, Lookup Queries, Price Actions

1) Need the custom object first
2) Then create the Price Rule where the custom object API name is populated in the "lookup object"
3) the price condition looks up to the price rule
4) lookup query > lookup field (populate with the api name of the field on the custom object)
5) price action - pushes the data from the custom object to the target object

comments.content: This is not true, price rule refers only the rental rate object and NOT the query
The Price Rule needs to be loaded before the Lookup Query since the Lookup Query has a lookup field to the Price Rule.

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: C
This order ensures that the dependent objects are deployed first before their dependents. In this case, Rental Rates and Lookup Queries need to be deployed first because they are referenced in the Price Rules' Lookup Queries. Price Rules should be deployed next because they are the primary object being deployed, followed by Price Conditions and Price Actions.

Selected Answer: A
A is correct - see https://help.salesforce.com/s/articleView?id=sf.cpq_lq_custom_data.htm&type=5

comments.content: It will not fail since the price rule record is uploaded first only to provide an id. It does not reference anything else as it is the parent record.

In which order should the admin deploy Price Rules with Lookup Queries to align with best practices?

choices.C: Rental Rates, Lookup Queries, Price Rules, Price Conditions, Price Actions
choices.A: Rental Rates, Price Rules, Price Conditions, Lookup Queries, Price Actions
